title: Pluralism has public debate, Corporatism is elite

content.question: Which of the following statements comparing pluralism and corporatism is correct?

choices.label: Pluralism describes a system with a stronger state than does corporatism.
Pluralism describes a federal system, while corporatism describes a unitary system.
Pluralism is much less common than corporatism in Western Europe.
Pluralism allows for greater predictability and state planning, whereas corporatism provides for greater flexibility.
Pluralism leads more often to public debates and controversies, whereas corporatism is associated more often with negotiations among elites.

content.answer: Pluralism leads more often to public debates and controversies, whereas corporatism is associated more often with negotiations among elites.
